channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-6227] SSH and cluster startup causes data loss
item.description:
In AssignmentManager#processDeadServersAndRegionsInTransition, if servershutdownhandler is processing and master consider it cluster startup, master will assign all user regions, however, servershutdownhandler has not completed splitting logs.

Let me describe it in more detail.

Suppose there are two regionservers A1 and B1, A1 carried META and ROOT

1.master restart and completed assignRootAndMeta

2.A1 and B1 are both restarted, new regionservers are A2 and B2

3.SSH which processed for A1 completed assigning ROOT and META

4.master do rebuilding user regions and no regions added to master's region list

5.master consider it as a cluster startup, and assign all user regions

6.SSH which processed for B1 start to split B1's logs

7.All regions' data carried by B1 would loss.
item.summary: SSH and cluster startup causes data loss

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
@ram
I think it is caused by HBASE-5916, because rebuildUserRegions use different online servers with splitLogAfterStartup.
Could you take a see?
Thanks.

In my opinion, an easy way to fix this issue is that master consider it as fail over if getDeadServers() are not empty.
But it will slow master's initialization

@Chunhui
Thanks for checking this.
I think if the ROOT and META are assigned to a new RS then in assignRootAndMeta it should split the log right? 


splitLogAndExpireIfOnline(currentRootServer);

splitLogAndExpireIfOnline(currentMetaServer);

@ram

I think if the ROOT and META are assigned to a new RS then in assignRootAndMeta it should split the log right?

Yes, it's right, but how about two regionservers, how about all the regionservers died and restarted between assignRootAndMeta and rebuildUserRegions, both will cause the case:
Master consider it as a cluster startup and SSH is processing.

@Chunhui
In both SSH and rebuildUserRegions we try to Scan META.
So if there is no META are we not waiting till it is available (Correct me if am wrong here)?
So that any way the SSH for META or SSH for ROOT will do splitlog right?
Also on seeing the scenario that you are saying and with my queries(doubts) above i felt there could be double assignment may be. I will once again go thro this place and see what happens..

@ram
Let me describe it in more detail.

Suppose there are two regionservers A1 and B1, A1 carried META and ROOT

1.master restart and completed assignRootAndMeta

2.A1 and B1 are both restarted, new regionservers are A2 and B2

3.SSH which processed for A1 completed assigning ROOT and META

4.master do rebuilding user regions and no regions added to master's region list

5.master consider it as a cluster startup, and assign all user regions

6.SSH which processed for B1 start to split B1's logs

7.All regions' data carried by B1 would loss.

@Chunhui
I got your issue now.
I think moving to failover we should also consider if there are any nodes while trying to do failover, we should not do the assignment of those regions in znode so that already SSH may be trying to process the splitlog.

Because this step


if (!nodes.isEmpty()) {

      for (String encodedRegionName : nodes) {

        processRegionInTransition(encodedRegionName, null, deadServers);

      }

    }

is done outside the loop that does assignment of regions in deadServers.
Submitting to QA

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12532363/HBASE-6227.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

-1 findbugs. The patch appears to introduce 7 new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.TestHRegion

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/2184//testReport/
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/2184//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-server.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/2184//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-common.html
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/2184//console

This message is automatically generated.

@ram
If we do the following for the above problem you mentioned, is it enough?


if (actualDeadServers.contains(deadServer.getKey())) {

        for (Pair<HRegionInfo, Result> deadRegion : deadServer.getValue()) {

          nodes.remove(deadRegion.getFirst().getEncodedName());

        }

        continue;

      }

@Chunhui
I think this should be fine...
Updating patch...

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12532648/HBASE-6227v2.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

-1 findbugs. The patch appears to introduce 7 new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/2197//testReport/
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/2197//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-server.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/2197//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-common.html
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/2197//console

This message is automatically generated.
+1 on patch v2.
+1 on patch. This along with HBASE-5916 helps in solving many issues that happens during master restart and SSH going parallely.

I am planning to commit this tomorrow. Pls provide your comments/suggestions.
@Chunhui
Could you provide a patch for 0.94 also?
Uploading patch for 94...

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment

against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

-1 patch. The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/2269//console

Planning to commit this now.

Commmitted to trunk and 0.94.
Thanks for the patch Chunhui.
Thanks for the review Ted.
